node.title: Easter 2022 in photos from around the world
node.description: Take a look at Easter weekend through the lens of photographers around the world.

node.title: One of Nelson's oldest commercial waterfront buildings up for sale
node.description: Nelson City Council is looking to sell or lease the Anchor Shipping & Foundry Co building on Wakefield Quay.

node.title: Ukraine war: Mariupol defenders will fight to the end - PM
node.description: Ukrainian defenders of the besieged port of Mariupol will fight to the end against Russian forces, the country's prime minister says.

node.title: Taranaki man shot at police stop had rammed police car
node.description: Police have named the man shot dead at a police stop in New Plymouth earlier this weekend, and say he had rammed a marked police car.

node.title: Home buyers increasingly resorting to pooling their resources - bank
node.description: As first-time buyers look to break into the property market, more and more people are open to the idea of buying their first home with friends. Audio

node.title: Ukraine war: Trucks stuck for miles to meet deadline to leave EU
node.description: A huge queue of trucks has formed on the Poland-Belarus border as Russian and Belarussian drivers try to leave the EU following a sanctions deadline.

node.title: Rugby headgear researchers look at protection effectiveness
node.description: University of Canterbury researchers are studying head knocks in junior rugby and the effect of World Rugby-approved headgear in collisions. Audio

node.title: Skydiving rules yet to be tightened in wake of US man's death
node.description: Recommendations to make skydiving near water safer have yet to pass their first hurdle, four years after a jumper drowned in Lake Wakatipu.

node.title: Man arrested after firing gun, pointing it at police in Auckland
node.description: A man has been arrested after allegedly pointing a gun at police and firing it three times at random in west Auckland.

node.title: Prince Charles 'heartbroken' at war; ailing Queen to miss Easter service
node.description: Prince Charles has highlighted the suffering of "innocent victims of conflict" in his Easter message, while Queen Elizabeth, who turns 96 this week, will miss attending Easter services.

node.title: Changing how we talk about autism
node.description: The autistic community hopes a new terminology resource will help people use appropriate language when talking about autism.

node.title: Nelson Hospital revamp improves ability to treat Covid-19 patients
node.description: More than $1 million has been spent reconfiguring Nelson Hospital to better treat patients with Covid-19.

node.title: Dark days during a sacred time
node.description: As Passover, Easter and Holy Week are celebrated around the world, death appears to be having its day in Ukraine. But even in Ukraine, bravely and with the help of much of the world -- it is a season holding the promise of freedom, and hope.

node.title: eVTOL: The flying vehicles that may be the future of transportation
node.description: Anderson Cooper reports on eVTOLs, flying vehicles that may one day be the answer to bumper-to-bumper traffic.

node.title: U.S. officials preparing for potential Russian cyberattacks
node.description: Bill Whitaker reports on the proven capabilities of Russia's hackers, who just a few years ago were able to infiltrate the computer network of a Kansas nuclear power plant.

node.title: Law change to allow deportation of potential terrorists, refugees on the cards
node.description: The government may change the law so would-be terrorists and refugees who are serious offenders could be sent back to their home countries.

node.title: Violence erupts again at Jerusalem holy site over key holiday weekend
node.description: The unrest happened just two days after clashes with Palestinians at the same site.

node.title: NZ connections to investigation of torture allegations by Australians in Timor
node.description: Opinion - The ABC's Mark Willacy tells how Four Corners investigated alleged torture and mistreatment by Australian soldiers in East Timor, and the NZ connection.

node.title: Bevin wins Tour of Turkey
node.description: New Zealand cyclist Patrick Bevin has scored the biggest win of his career, with victory in the Tour of Turkey.

node.title: 'Surrender or die' - Russia's ultimatum for Mariupol
node.description: Russia told Ukrainian forces fighting in Mariupol to lay down arms on Sunday morning to save their lives, but there were no immediate reports of activity hours after the ultimatum took effect.

node.title: Comment: A very Good Friday for Super Rugby Pacific
node.description: Comment - If there was ever evidence of a game living up to the hype, it was Friday night's blockbuster between the Blues and Crusaders. Video

node.title: Head of Arise Church resigns board seat following allegations
node.description: The founding pastor of one of the country's biggest pentecostal churches has resigned from its board amid controversy.

node.title: Black Ferns coach Glenn Moore announces resignation
node.description: Black Ferns Coach Glenn Moore has announced his resignation, days after a scathing review into team management and culture.

node.title: Russia claims its forces have cleared most of Mariupol
node.description: Russian missile strikes hit Ukraine's capital Kyiv and other cities on Saturday, as Moscow said its troops had cleared the urban area of Mariupol.

node.title: Hat-tricks and protests at Old Trafford
node.description: Cristiano Ronaldo starred as Manchester United won in the English Premier League amid scenes of fan protest at Old Trafford.

node.title: Air NZ deals with flood of phone calls as borders reopen
node.description: Air New Zealand has been dealing with a flood of phone calls from customers wanting information as the borders reopen.

node.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation" on April 17, 2022
node.description: On this "Face the Nation" broadcast, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba and Sen. Chris Coons join Margaret Brennan.

node.title: Container ship finally freed after being stuck in Chesapeake Bay for weeks
node.description: The Ever Forward was refloated just before 7 a.m. Sunday by two barges and five tugboats.

node.title: Transcript: Sister Norma Pimentel on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Sister Norma Pimentel, the executive director of the Catholic Charities of Rio Grande Valley, that aired Sunday, April 17, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Full transcript: World Food Programme chief David Beasley on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with David Beasley, head of the World Food Programme, that aired Sunday, April 17, 2022, on "Face the Nation."
